page.title: 04ALKHAM CLUBS AND SOCIETIES
page.content: The most thriving club, the Women's Institute, meet every second Tuesday in the Village Hall. The Over 6O's Club is a social club which organises outings and coffee mornings. A local Good Neighbours Club holds jumble sales and whist drives, the money raised is used for the benefit of the village and finaces a childrens Christmas party. There is a conservation based society, The Alkham Valley Society, established to protect the local environment and amenities. Alkham Cricket Club is based in the village, using the local Vicarage meadow and pavilion, but few members now reside in the village. The locality supports two equestrian societies. There are no clubs for children in the area. On occasions there have been a pre-school play group, Sunday school and youth club.
